snippet.title: Talking with Poland's foreign minister about the Ukraine crisis and Russia's next moves
snippet.description: An interview with Foreign Minister Radoslaw "Radek" Sikorski.

snippet.title: Tiny power plants hold promise for nuclear energy
snippet.description: Small underground nuclear power plants that could be cheaper to build than their behemoth counterparts may herald the future for an energy industry under intense scrutiny since the Fukushima disaster, the incoming head of the Nuclear Energy Agency told The Associated Press.

snippet.title: Berlusconi given community service for tax fraud
snippet.description: Former Italian Premier Silvio Berlusconi was ordered Tuesday to spend four hours a week helping the elderly to repay society for his tax fraud conviction, a sentence that imposes few restrictions on his campaigning in the upcoming European elections.

snippet.title: Artists from Italy and Brazil displayed in two inspired D.C. exhibits
snippet.description: Italian Embassy hosts 'Unanswered Prayers'; IDB Cultural Center displays Brazilian artists' works.

snippet.title: Italy court overturns ban on egg or sperm donation
snippet.description: Italy's constitutional court has struck down a ban on egg or sperm donation for infertile couples.

snippet.title: The Hotlist: April 2014
snippet.description: The Hotlist is a monthly look ahead at some of the best things to eat, drink, see and do in April.

snippet.title: The Hotlist: April 2014
snippet.description: Welcome to the Hotlist, a monthly preview of things to taste, see and do in the weeks ahead.

snippet.title: Pope Francis hosts President Obama for 'cordial' talks
snippet.description: Pope Francis met with President Obama for the first time on Thursday (March 27) in a meeting heavy in symbolism that reportedly touched on some hot-button disputes between the White House and the U.S. Catholic bishops.

snippet.title: The insane, morbid history of urban BASE-jumping
snippet.description: Three parachutists are in the news today for jumping from the Freedom Tower -- but it's been done many times before.

snippet.title: White House: No G8 meeting in Sochi
snippet.description: It's something a majority of Americans oppose, according to a CNN poll taken last week.
